title: SB 1.16.25 - 30 Part 7 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami |  07-02-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: That is the first incarnation of the Lord before the creation of this entire material cosmic manifestation.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the topic of the Lord's transcendental qualities and explains the concept of Maha Vishnu as the first incarnation before creation, residing in the material energy portion of the spiritual sky.

segments.key_quote: So, this material world is created when the Lord lies down on the causal ocean and goes to sleep.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on Maha Vishnu entering the material region, lying down on the causal ocean, and entering Yoga Nidra, which is described as a mystic slumber that initiates the material creation.

segments.key_quote: And he dreams and in that dreaming state there is the creation of the material world. It is a product of the mahat tattva.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the material world is created from the Lord's dreaming state, which activates the dormant material energy (Mahat Tattva) and initiates the differentiation into various elements.

segments.key_quote: Still the whole creation appears to be a factual presentation.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how the Lord combines the elements and even though the material world is produced in the Lord's dreaming condition, it is still a factual presentation, highlighting the Lord's complete control and consciousness.

segments.key_quote: Thus whenever and wherever he does appear he does so in his fullness.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the Lord always appears in his fullness, never lacking in power or knowledge, and extends his mercy even to demons by granting them salvation when they are killed by him.

segments.key_quote: Thus, the Supreme Lord is worshipable even by Brahma and Shiva, the greatest of all demigods.
segments.summary: This segment explains that even liberated souls are attracted to Krishna, proving his transcendental nature, and that he is worshiped by the greatest demigods like Brahma and Shiva.

segments.key_quote: Nobody can actually estimate or count the qualities of the lord, nor can anybody estimate in what quantity he has got those qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by discussing the Lord's creative energy, the countless incarnations, and the plenary expansions in the spiritual world, emphasizing that the Lord's qualities are unfathomable and cannot be estimated.
